headline: Chicken Fajita Pasta Bake
description: This easy chicken fajita pasta bake recipe is made with black beans, corn, and ziti pasta smothered in a tasty sauce made with salsa and cream cheese.
name: Chicken Fajita Pasta Bake
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (16 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Add ziti and return to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and green pepper; cook and stir until soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Cook chicken in the same skillet until no longer pink in the center, 7 to 10 minutes.
Combine salsa, cream cheese, and taco seasoning in a saucepan over low heat; cook and stir until cream cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine ziti, chicken, salsa mixture, onion mixture, black beans, and corn in a large bowl. Add 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese and mix until combined. Pour into a baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining Cheddar over top. Continue to bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Just made this and It’s delicious. I would add diced or crushed tomatoes instead of salsa next time since there is fresh onions and peppers all ready and the taco seasoning gives enough flavor. Serves with tortilla chips. Yum!!

What a clever way to turn chicken fajitas into creamy comfort food! This was delicious; I subbed kidney beans for the black beans and used leftover grilled chicken breast and corn cut off the cob. Great results, will definitely make again!
This made a ton of pasta. Pretty good but a little to rich for me.
Followed main recipe plus added advice from others with 8oz sour cream and chicken broth. Tastes great from first try
Absolutely delicious. Only thing I changed was I added 1 cup of noodle water.

Really good and a hit for everyone. We leave out the peppers and black beans and add extra corn. 30 minutes in the oven seems a bit long when everything is already fully cooked. We have cut the oven time down to 15 minutes both times we’ve made it and that seems just right.
Fantastic dinner! I used all the ingredients plus a can of rotelle tomatoes and green chilies. The whole family was in love with the outcome
Very delicious. Made it with no changes. Will make it again. Thanks for the recipe.

This recipe has a perfect blend of textures and flavors! I went by the recipe exactly and it was a HOMERUN! I love anything with black beans and corn. I am not huge on meat most days so I cut up the chicken into smaller cubes. My entire family gobbled it up. The recipe yielded plenty for leftovers too...that's always a WIN!
Super easy and became a quick family favorite
I doubled the recipe and had enough to make 2 big baking dishes and 1 vegetarian. added about 2tbsp cayanne to one and everyone loved that.
I made this exactly as written. It was delicious. I have a family of 4 and this fed us all with tons left over for lunch the next day. I highly recommend!!
Loved this dish! I used red bell peppers because that's what I had on hand. Halved the cream cheese and added sour cream. My family has requested it over and over now. It's a keeper.

Delicious. I used Costco's cooked chicken, which saved time and tasted very good. I had enough mixture to fill one 9x13 pan and another smaller pan, so I might reduce the pasta next time or freeze the second pan. I used a red pepper instead of green and it worked well. This is a keeper!
Big hit! I subbed sour cream for half of the cream cheese, as many reviewers suggested. Also added 1/2 C water to moisten it up.
Fantastic recipe! My only issue was that it takes quite a bit longer than 10 minutes to put it together.

This is DELICIOUS! I’ve made it many times now. It’s one of those recipes we make about once a month because it’s so good! I follow the recipe as stated and it reheats fine the next day. It makes a lot so I usually take leftovers to my parents and friends, or else I’d be eating leftovers every meal for days. 10/10 favorite recipe!
It was a hit! Next time I will decrease pasta and increase chicken... I decided to add black olives to the mix

This is a very good dish and easy to alter for your own tastes. The only change I made was using 1 cream cheese and 1 cup sour cream. When I decided to make this dish I made a shopping list. Got to the store, forgot my list, forgot the cream cheese. Sent my daughter to the store, forgot to tell her to get 2, hence the substitution. I will make this again but next time I will use Monterey Jack instead of cheddar (personal preference), HOT salsa because I like spicy. Thank you for this recipe.

Hands down one of my favorite meals from this site. I followed the suggestion to cut the cream cheese in half and replace it with sour cream. Huge hit with everyone I've ever made it for adults and kids alike.
I am new to cooking and this was not difficult, I swapped out ground beef for the chicken. Turned out amazing.

Only used one block of cream cheese. Added mushrooms. I didn’t use a separate pan for the cream cheese mixture- just tossed everything in with the veggies after I sautéed them and it worked fine. Then added the pasta back to the same pot. Made cleanup a little easier. This is a staple in my house and the leftovers are fantastic!
I made a half recipe and used spicy taco seasoning. Did not have ziti pasta so used elbow. This will become a regular in the rotation.

I followed the directions exactly and this is a super delicious recipe! I'm looking forward to making it again. I think next time I will shred up some rotisserie chicken instead of using cubed chicken breasts.
Tasted great, dice the onions and peppers!
Easy to prepare and such a tasty meal.

This tasted so much better than I expected! I followed the instructions exactly, except I used beef instead of chicken, put half cream cheese and and half sour cream, and I left out the corn and onions because I’m just not a fan of either. I used mild cheddar cheese. When it was done I put it in a bowl and crush up a few Doritos and put sour cream on top...mixed it up and it made it taste even better! I’d definitely make this again!!! I loved it and so did my family!
One of the worst dishes I've made and tried to eat.

This was good just as it was. I didn't tweak it at all, and the whole family really enjoyed it. My one son doesn't like spicy foods, so mild salsa and taco seasoning was used. If he weren't home, I'd maybe use salsa with a bit more heat.
Yummy. And I had all the ingredients during the quarantine!

I read many reviews and adjusted the recipe to get the best results. Added 1 cup chicken broth to mixture to prevent dryness, used a packet of fajita mix instead of taco mix , a small can chopped black olives, small can of corn and diced onion and yellow pepper before sauteing. I also used 2 large chicken breasts that were cooked on the grill. I filled a 9X13 baking dish as well as a large square baking dish (which I will freeze). Next time I will 1/2 the recipe. I was going to do 1/2 cream cheese and 1/2 sour cream, but I forgot. It was still good with all cream cheese. I also used whole grain rotini noodles. This recipe is a keeper and would be great to feed a crowd.

This is a keeper! I used bow tie pasta, looks cute. I didn’t have salsa, so I used petite diced tomatoes instead. I left out the peppers since we were quarantined and didn’t have those either. I made the taco seasoning from here and used 1-8oz cream cheese and 8oz sour cream. It makes a lot and taste good leftover win-win!
It’s very difficult to find a recipe the entire family likes. The night I made this everyone in my family had seconds and raved about it!! so delicious?!!!
Yummy!! Fam loved it and one of our kids is very picky!! Not this time.
The recipe is great! I made it as it is. I wouldn’t change much besides spicing up the chicken some. Maybe with Cajun seasoning but it was a very good quick and easy dinner!
Read reviews after making but was still delicious! Next time will definitely chop green pepper and onion.
I cut the recipe in half because there's just two of us. It still made a lot. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
loved it!

Completely fantastic. My boyfriend doesn’t like creamy cheese sauce so I thinned it out with a half cup of chicken broth in the cream cheese mix. There was so much left over for the two of us that I wish I had cut the recipe in half.
This was such a great recipe. I used lentil penne pasta and 8oz plain cream cheese and 8oz jalapeño cream cheese for a little extra zing. Definitely will make it again!!!
I followed the recipe. I can’t think of any way to make it any better. The sauce was delicious, I could eat it right out of the bowl. My family raves about it for days. I’ll make it again and again.
Very good and makes a ton! Maybe next time I'll add some black olives and a chipotle pepper, for variety, but it's quite nice as is.

I made this last night for dinner and my Hubby loved it. I made it with gluten free pasta and half cream cheese and sour cream. I also added about 2 cups of pasta water to it. He took leftovers for lunch today:) and froze the rest for future lunches.

I was a bit skeptical about trying this recipe as it requires salsa and black beans (not a fan of Mexican food)... oh how I am ecstatic that I put my skepticism aside and gave this recipe a try.... D E L I C I O U S ! ! !
Super easy, step-by-step instructions! 
THANK YOU for giving me something new to try!

Y U M ! ! !
I made no changes but the recipes makes a great deal of food. If you are cooking for 4 to 6 I would cut it in half. It is very good and satisfying.

This was very good. Made a lot. I had frozen onion, with 3 pepper colors already sliced, so I used it instead of fresh. I also used the Mexican three blended cheese, instead of the cheddar. Was going to try freezing up the extra. I was told no, it wouldn’t last very long for that. It’s a keeper recipe. Will make it again in the future.

Yummy..I used whole wheat spaghetti broken in half, (from one of my Costco binges) and a can of fire roasted tomatoes salsa style since I didn't have a jar of salsa. Used a pkg of McCormick's fajita SAUCE ( been sitting around for ages) and shredded Costco roast chicken. Did add some pasta water and chicken broth to casserole as other reviewers had suggested along with 8 oz. cream cheese and 12 oz sour cream (so I wouldn't have to put 1/4 c back in refrig.). It was a hit!
Excellent dish! Great for a potluck. Used rotini pasta, mexican cheese blend and diced my onion and bell pepper. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
Too much cream cheese for me. I brick would have been sufficient. Too cheesy. Otherwise, good flavors

Quite good and makes a ton. I made the recipe as written. For those that like it spicier use a hot salsa or add hot sauce. I do think I will try a 1/4 to 1/2 cup of chicken stock (as others suggested) next time just to thin out the consistency. The only reason I made it a 4 star was it screams for acid. A bit of lime juice at the end may help. I topped with sour cream and fresh tomatoes when serving.
Only change I made was to half the recipe for just my hubby and me and to use fajita seasoning instead of taco. Very good!

I halved the pasta and cream cheese and thought it was outstanding. My 9 year old didn’t like it as much but I’m going to keep making it because I think she’ll grow to like it more. I used garden banana peppers instead of onion and red, yellow and orange bell instead of green. I also used homemade taco seasoning to control the salt.
It was soooo good. My family absolutely loved it. Was so easy to make.

This is what I changed... I used 3lbs of chicken breast, used penne instead of ziti, omitted taco seasoning, corn and black beans and took other reviewers suggestions and used 8oz sour cream and 8oz cream cheese. I used olive oil to sauté my peppers and onion (I used two green peppers since my onions are really large) and sautéed them with 1tbsp of minced garlic (since I sautéed onions and peppers separately I ended up using 2tbsp of minced garlic). I also cooked my chicken breast differently as I needed a to make a stock so I was able to shred it as some reviewers had suggested they wished they had done. Also using the chicken in a stock helped keep it moist and full of flavor (my stock is seasoned so the chicken absorbed the seasonings). After I sautéed the veggies I added them to the stock to soften more and cook with the chicken. Because my chicken was seasoned from the stock I omitted the taco seasoning and my family is not too big on black beans and corn just seemed out of place. I also added 1 cup of my stock to the pasta as I was mixing everything together as some reviewers said that after baking it was dry. This made two 9 x 13 pans and was so delicious. Will definitely be making this again as it was a huge hit with my husband and brother and my 1 year old girls loved it.
This meal is hearty! It’s amazing as left overs!

Just made this tonight. Came out great. Followed others recommendations and added 1 cup of chicken broth and substituted 1 of the cream cheeses for sour cream. Personally I would have liked shredded chicken a wee bit more. Made full amount and will have another full meal in the freezer. Lots of dishes but worth it since we have a dishwasher.

This was good! I used a packet of fajita seasoning with a 1/4 cup of water to cook the chicken onions and peppers in. It gave an otherwise bland chicken a good kick and the flavors blended well with the rest of the dish. I will definitely be making this again.

This was good! I used a packet of fajita seasoning with a 1/4 cup of water to cook the chicken onions and peppers in. It gave an otherwise bland chicken a good kick and the flavors blended well with the rest of the dish. I will definitely be making this again.

This recipe does make a lot. I’m thankful for that because I was able to give a pan to my mother, and her friends. The only substitutions I made were because I listened to other reviewers. I cut the cream cheese in half, and substituted it with sour cream. MY daughters don’t like to see Bell peppers, or onions, so I substituted it with the powders, and I didn’t use chicken broth. I substituted that with one 10.5 oz. can of cream of chicken. Definitely a family favorite!!!
Made it exactly like the recipe. It was a bit dry.
Sooooo good! I also did half the cream cheese and half top the tator! Garnished with cilantro and cherub tomatoes! Yum!
Did not add cheddar, and did not bake it. Took it like regular pasta.
I'm shocked at how good this is

It was so delicious!! I made it weight watchers friendly so I used 1/3 fat cream cheese and fat free cheddar cheese. Only 6 smart points per serving and it’s a huge portion!! I will definitely make this often and I’m probably going to freeze some because it’s a lot of food.
No leftovers!!
Kids and wife loved it. My youngest asked me to set some aside for her school lunch tomorrow!
Delicious, easy, and made enough for leftovers.

I changed a few things and it turned out fantastic. I used 1 - 8oz cream cheese and 1 cup sour cream. I omitted the beans and corn because my salsa had those ingredients. Also added milk to it for reheating. It turned out as creamy as the first time.
Very good! Made it with ground burger instead of chicken because it's what I had on hand but next time I will use chicken. Family enjoyed this and said it's a keeper.

Made this was awesome.
I added jalapeños and tomatoe.
Highly recommend this one.
I will definitely make this again. It was fast and easy to make and my family loved it
We only had half the amount of cheese so used 4oz in the bake and 4oz on top and was perfect. I would also use more salsa next time.
A staple in our house. Thank you for posting this. I cover with foil for 20 minutes add extra cheese then uncover for 10. Also, I chop onions and green pepper. We love this recipe.
This recipe makes a huge amount. It was tasty and I think kids would like it if they like Mexican food.
Can someone tell me what size baking dish. It is ordinarily included in instructions. I am a novice cook so would really appreciate the answer.
I didn’t use corn or black beans and turned out great.

I used penne as I had no ziti. I thought this had too much cream cheese and insufficient corn. The beans added nothing to it. I will use less cream cheese and skip the beans next time. The taste did not justify the number of pots, pans, bowls, spatulas and spoons used. Microwaved the next day it tasted pastry. I give it 3 stars based upon potential. My taster, on the other hand, absolutely loved it. She gives it 5 stars and also suggests less cream cheese. She is concerned about the high caliber tie and carbohydrate content and suggests that once a year is sufficient. If it was healthier she would eat it more frequently. As it is she wants me to freeze the remainder in small portions.

OH! MY! GOD!
This is so good! I followed the recipe, changing very little of it. I used a ready-made fajita mix though. Other than that, I stayed true to what was posted.

This was a hit with myself and my spouse. We ate on it for 2 days, I took a serving to work twice, and we still have a little left in the freezer.

I'd recommend this to any chicken fajita lover.

this was fantastic. I made half the recipe as other reviewer's advised it made double the amount stated. the only thing I didn't like it seemed to have too much peppers with green pepper already being in the salsa I used. next time I'll only add a fraction of the amount if bell pepper is in my salsa. I did half cream cheese half sour cream like others. and also added a cup of chicken broth once in the dish. I didn't cook my noodles before hand. I like the texture more firm. noodles cooked prior to baking seem too mushy for me. used ridge ziti. over all it was a great dish and we will be making again but with less pepper . oh and I think I will try fajita seasoning next time.

Awesome flavors! I didn’t have all ingredients so substituted ziti with egg noodles, chicken with ground turkey, and used green tomatillo salsa... it tastes SO GOOD!!! I also split cream cheese with sour cream as suggested by others. Try this and you will love it!

Me and my mother just loved this dish, the only tweeks I made the second time we're that I added about a 1/4 cup more cream cheese to get the sauce right. I also used a half of can extra of the corn and black beans. I recommend On the Border Salsa with this. Another good point of the recipe is the quantity of the food made, left-overs for days :) I'm also thinking of adding a twist of lime to sauce to zest it up.
I didn't have any ziti, so I used penne. Other than that I followed the recipe as is. Lots of pots and pans to clean up, but it was very tasty.

Made this for dinner tonight, it was very good and hubby liked it so it's a keeper. The only change I made was adding some chicken broth as suggested by other reviewers. It was a bit dry on top when I removed it from the oven after first twenty minutes, especially the pasta. I think covering with foil would help with that and leave uncovered after topping with the cheese. Great Mexican Casserole with great flavor. I can see this being one of my go to recipes for a quick easy dinner for family and friends.
It came out delicious, seemed like it was gone 5 minutes after I made it.
cooked exactly as recipe did add two jalapenos with the green pepper, this was delicious, definitely will eat again

I did not have ziti pasta so I used farfalle. I though it was going to be to much pasta for sauce, so I added some more salsa. Next time I will use 2 peppers and 2 onions. This makes a lot had to send some home with my daughter and her family. Also sent some to sister and her boyfriend and had more than enough for husband and I. Next time I will make half of recipe, This is a keeper and flavorful.
Great flavor enjoyed it a lot, along with the family.
Added a can of cheddar cheese soup to the salsa cream cheese mixture

Great Recipe! I was surprised how much I liked it. It would make a great tailgating treat. I did swap some sour cream for half the cream cheese as suggested and also used homemade taco seasoning (I always keep extra made up). I used veggie pasta which has an orange tinge so it really fit well with the fajita ingredients and also used red onion to be more authentic.
REALLY good!! Serves a lot of people.
Turn out great!!!!
Loved this :)

This is my second time making it. Last time it was a little dry to reheat, so I added about 3/4 cup of reserved starch water from cooking the pasta. It made it perfect! The one thing to keep in mind about this recipe, however, is that it makes a LOT. Like a full 9 x 13 pan lot.

Very good meal, made it for dinner. I followed the instructions to the T, but for a personal reference I'm going to be taking a few items out. Overall my fiance and I enjoyed cooking this dish together, fill us up.
Delicious. Huge hit
No Changes and I will definitely will be made again.

Everyone, especially my 2 boys, loved this. As reviews suggested I added chicken broth and mixed 8oz of sour cream with just 8oz of cream cheese. My family couldn’t get enough. Will definitely make again. Possibly with beef...my kids idea.
My children loved this! I followed the recipe except I didn't have cilantro.

Followed directions verbatim, however, it turned out dry. My suggestion would be to add extra salsa. Also, this recipe made almost two large baking pans worth of food, which I wasn’t expecting. Definitely a good large quantity recipe.
